# The `BinaryStreamReader` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Provides read only access to a subclass of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a></code>. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Provides read only access to a subclass of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a></code>.

Provides bounds checking and helpers for writing certain common data types such as null-terminated strings, integers in various flavors of endianness, etc. Can be subclassed to provide reading of custom datatypes, although no are overridable.

Definition at line 29 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>.

### peek() {#a31521a2e6c1afa0308811515bc86c88f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint8&#95;t BinaryStreamReader::peek () const</>}>
Examine the next byte of the underlying stream without advancing the stream&#39;s offset.

If the stream is empty the behavior is undefined.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
the next byte in the stream.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h/#l00260">260</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamreader-cpp/#l00159">159</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamreader-cpp">BinaryStreamReader.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### readArray() {#ab88a8b3835c1028f8fd6c2b23f396d30}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::BinaryStreamReader::readArray (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; T &gt; &amp; Array, uint32&#95;t NumElements)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Get a reference to a <code>NumElements</code> element array of objects of type T from the underlying stream as if by memcpy, and store the resulting array slice into <code>array</code>.

It is up to the caller to ensure that objects of type T can be safely treated in this manner. Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read object. Whether a copy occurs depends upon the implementation of the underlying stream.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h/#l00178">178</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### readArray() {#adb4cfdc89c66954507c06d25ec1e267f}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T, typename U&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::BinaryStreamReader::readArray (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/varstreamarray">VarStreamArray</a>&lt; T, U &gt; &amp; Array, uint32&#95;t Size, uint32&#95;t Skew=0)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Read a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/varstreamarray">VarStreamArray</a> of size <code>Size</code> bytes and store the result into <code>Array</code>.

Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read array. Never causes a copy (although iterating the elements of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/varstreamarray">VarStreamArray</a> may, depending upon the implementation of the underlying stream).


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h/#l00208">208</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### readArray() {#a24cb794c8858cc968924505f3a5ac37b}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::BinaryStreamReader::readArray (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedstreamarray">FixedStreamArray</a>&lt; T &gt; &amp; Array, uint32&#95;t NumItems)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Read a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedstreamarray">FixedStreamArray</a> of <code>NumItems</code> elements and store the result into <code>Array</code>.

Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read array. Never causes a copy (although iterating the elements of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedstreamarray">FixedStreamArray</a> may, depending upon the implementation of the underlying stream).


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

### readBytes() {#a2d56063bcd6039c9372e485e609cf692}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamReader::readBytes (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; &amp; Buffer, uint32&#95;t Size)</>}>
Read <code>Size</code> bytes from the underlying stream at the current offset and and set <code>Buffer</code> to the resulting data slice.

Whether a copy occurs depends on the implementation of the underlying stream. Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read data.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

### readInteger() {#a6bb348b0b716cb9d060ecaef7a49dcc6}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::BinaryStreamReader::readInteger (T &amp; Dest)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Read an integer of the specified endianness into <code>Dest</code> and update the stream&#39;s offset.

The data is always copied from the stream&#39;s underlying buffer into <code>Dest</code>. Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read data.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h/#l00067">67</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### readLongestContiguousChunk() {#aa580bf8bd5d8f755f546fa9df986260b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamReader::readLongestContiguousChunk (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; &amp; Buffer)</>}>
Read as much as possible from the underlying string at the current offset without invoking a copy, and set <code>Buffer</code> to the resulting data slice.

Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read data.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h/#l00049">49</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamreader-cpp/#l00028">28</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamreader-cpp">BinaryStreamReader.cpp</a>.

### readObject() {#a07e25e055f92f545f94821c4a3cbded8}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::BinaryStreamReader::readObject (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> T &#42;&amp; Dest)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Get a pointer to an object of type T from the underlying stream, as if by memcpy, and store the result into <code>Dest</code>.

It is up to the caller to ensure that objects of type T can be safely treated in this manner. Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read object. Whether a copy occurs depends upon the implementation of the underlying stream.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h/#l00160">160</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### readStreamRef() {#a03bf40efbeb72552b33026fa1608280b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamReader::readStreamRef (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> &amp; Ref)</>}>
Read the entire remainder of the underlying stream into <code>Ref</code>.

This is equivalent to calling getUnderlyingStream().slice(Offset). Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point to the end of the stream. Never causes a copy.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h/#l00131">131</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamreader-h">BinaryStreamReader.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamreader-cpp/#l00129">129</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamreader-cpp">BinaryStreamReader.cpp</a>.

### readStreamRef() {#a4364664daec8a6dd65d2161b883cf5fc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamReader::readStreamRef (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> &amp; Ref, uint32&#95;t Length)</>}>
Read <code>Length</code> bytes from the underlying stream into <code>Ref</code>.

This is equivalent to calling getUnderlyingStream().slice(Offset, Length). Updates the stream&#39;s offset to point after the newly read object. Never causes a copy.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully read, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>
